commit_message:
Fix serialized playbook runs

Essential services which can be disabled in the loadbalancer should run
serialized with only 1 host per service in the first batch and all other
hosts in the second batch. This ensures that the service is always
available during playbook runs.

For plays which run serialized over more than one group the existing
code resulted in only the first group running in this manner
and all other groups having all hosts in the second batch. This is
fixed by putting the first host of each group into the first batch and
all remaining host into the second batch.

Change-Id: I1bc99b14925139febc825698eb7a47ef07a415e1

commit_message:
Fix typo when nova pool is built and wrong flag during cli creation

When the upgrade from nautilus to pacific is performed, the regular
cephadm playbook fails during pools creation. This is caused due to a
typo in the build_pools task that processes the vms pool. In addition,
during the same run, if no spec is present, post.yaml fails getting the
right cli due to a wrong 'mount_spec' flag value. This change fixes both
failures removing the extra space that caused the pool creation failure
and the mount_spec flag that caused an issue in the get_cli task.

Closes-Bug: #1990195

Signed-off-by: Francesco Pantano <fpantano@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I253c8feb72404e2620821472447b08905d5cd16b

commit_message:
increase disk_erasure_coconcurrency

When we added concurrent disk erasures, we kept the concurrency
to 1 as to not risk any different oeprator behavior, at the cost
of not faster erasure times.

That being said, we have had the setting in place for some time
and we have received no reports of issues, so we are incrementing
it to four as that should be still quite relatively safe from a
concurrency standpoint for disk controllers in systems.

Change-Id: I6326422d60ec024a739ca596f46552bbd91b0419

commit_message:
Add the option to deploy keystone without apache

This change gives the keystone role the ability to deploy keystone using
only uWSGI, which eliminates Apache and all of its dependencies from the
environment. While this capability is not as feature rich as the apache
based deployment, which is still the default, it does offer a signficant
reduction in process overhead targeting minimal deployment usec-ases,
for deployments which do not need or want advanced keystone features
this is a huge benefit.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
Change-Id: I5a8484082f6331d2c5a452af2760c8e79d44fab8

commit_message:
Install Fedora ifcfg NM compat package

Starting with Fedora 36 the NetworkManager package no longer includes
ifcfg support by default. You need an additional package
"NetworkManager-initscripts-ifcfg-rh" to pull in the compatibility
plugin. Glean's support for Fedora relies on this compatibility system
so we install this package via the simple-init element package deps.

Change-Id: I76ac39b8dedcb1c5bc4595aedc0a732c99c8721e

commit_message:
Fix dynamic-address-fact gathering with tags

Right now an intermittent issue exists, since setup module does not run
when play is launched with --tags. dynamic-address-fact.yml is included
rather then imported thus tags should be properly applied in include
statement.

Because of that, facts were not gathered, and if facts are expired,
this would lead to changing config and all kind of nasty issues.

So we apply `always` tag to the facts gathering to ensure facts are
in place.

Change-Id: Ib1e3a47acc34ff6d8e6de9555aea59ee8aa244e7
(cherry picked from commit 1d1b72cbe5a7452b234d0d2233c811645b7b559d)

commit_message:
Fix dynamic-address-fact gathering with tags

Right now an intermittent issue exists, since setup module does not run
when play is launched with --tags. dynamic-address-fact.yml is included
rather then imported thus tags should be properly applied in include
statement.

Because of that, facts were not gathered, and if facts are expired,
this would lead to changing config and all kind of nasty issues.

So we apply `always` tag to the facts gathering to ensure facts are
in place.

Change-Id: Ib1e3a47acc34ff6d8e6de9555aea59ee8aa244e7
(cherry picked from commit 1d1b72cbe5a7452b234d0d2233c811645b7b559d)

commit_message:
Add linkchecking

Enable the built-in Sphinx 'linkcheck' builder and
fix initial findings.

Add this as an opportunistic build target only. The process is
long, and false positives are common (mostly anchor-related
for some reason). There is also already a third-party
company-wide service in place. This builder however will lead
to better link hygiene as it is stricter (mostly for anchors).
It also records all redirects, which should eventually be
replaced by proper links.

commit_message:
Document existence of non-production "fake" driver

Ironic has fake drivers for development use. Document that they are
not suitable for production.

Story: 1326269
Task: 9877
Change-Id: Ibe6d43e1740a95b1cb3886394afaf8545de00e54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/84/857984/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========== Fake driver =========== Overview ======== The ``fake`` hardware interfaces are what they claim to be: fake. Use of these interfaces should be limited to non-production environments, as it literally does not perform any of the actions typically expected of those interfaces. Developers can use ``fake`` interfaces to mock out nodes for testing without those nodes needing to exist with physical or virtual hardware.

commit_message:
Software RAID: Continue on bootloader installation errors

The Software RAID code path uses grub2-install rather than
efibootmgr. However, newer versions of grub2-install raise
an error for UEFI due to the lack of secure boot support.
Deployments may still work, so we continue despite the error
until the Software RAID code has been refactored to rely
on efibootmgr.

This is a refinement to commit
ca6499b62c47b6588b2382f442dbc690140453d5.

Change-Id: I4a11d9060113226c889e5b7f26d93a009d138ba7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/11/825311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not software_raid: msg = (_("Failed to install a bootloader when " "deploying node %(node)s. Error: %(error)s") % {'node': node.uuid, 'error': agent_client.get_command_error(result)}) log_and_raise_deployment_error(task, msg) else: # NOTE(arne_wiebalck): The Software RAID code path uses # grub2-install rather than efibootmgr. However, newer # versions of grub2-install raise an error for UEFI due # to the lack of secure boot support. Deployments may # still work, so we continue despite the error until # the Software RAID code has been refactored to rely # on efibootmgr. LOG.info('Could not install bootloader for whole disk ' 'image for node %(node)s, Error: %(error)s"', {'node': node.uuid, 'error': agent_client.get_command_error(result)}) return
deleted_lines: msg = (_("Failed to install a bootloader when " "deploying node %(node)s. Error: %(error)s") % {'node': node.uuid, 'error': agent_client.get_command_error(result)}) log_and_raise_deployment_error(task, msg)

commit_message:
Change VM_COUNT to 2

Due to the tempest change where we are attempting
to run both wholedisk and partition image jobs,
We realistically need two VMs on the queens branch
to schedule the jobs.

While this change has been proposed for newer jobs
as I13da6275c04ffc6237a7f2edf25c03b4ddee936a,
the queens branch is radically different configuration
so backporting that change was not possible.

Change-Id: I1931209d476d1d5dec84add9cb5ed6dd8a09dbfe

commit_message:
Pin virtualbmc to 2.2.0 for Stable CI

Current master branch of virtualbmc removes support for python
3.6, however the python for this branch is 3.6. As such, we need to
pin the version for comaptability.

Change-Id: I72d0f9e675cb669ed65239d7076f9256c0ad14be

commit_message:
[postgres] Update postgres to 14.5

Updated postgres binary version to 14.5.

Also replaced deprecated config item wal_keep_segments with wal_keep_size.

Change-Id: Ie86850f8ebb8bfaae4ba5457409d3920b230ce9c

subject: Correct Image properties lookup for paths
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-20 02:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/correct-source-path-handling-lookups-4ce2023a56372f10.yaml', 'ironic/common/pxe_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_pxe_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d8590454b19fc66508aae9a5f4334fe7bffa8582', 'message': "Correct Image properties lookup for paths

The image lookup process, when handed a path attempts
to issue a HEAD request against the path and gets a
response which is devoid of details like a content length
or any properties. This is expected behavior, however if
we have a path, we also know we don't need to explicitly
attempt to make an HTTP HEAD request in an attempt to
match the glance ``kernel_id`` -> ``kernel`` and similar
value population behavior.

Also removes an invalid test which was written before the
overall method was fully understood.

And fixes the default fallback for kickstart template
configuration, so that it uses a URL instead of a
direct file path.

And fix logic in the handling of image property result
set, where the code previously assumed a ``stage2``
ramdisk was always required, and based other cleanup
upon that.

Change-Id: I589e9586d1279604a743746952aeabbc483825df
(cherry picked from commit 4d653ac225a26dd83e81477f9d1152fe385c64aa)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct Image properties lookup for paths

The image lookup process, when handed a path attempts
to issue a HEAD request against the path and gets a
response which is devoid of details like a content length
or any properties. This is expected behavior, however if
we have a path, we also know we don't need to explicitly
attempt to make an HTTP HEAD request in an attempt to
match the glance ``kernel_id`` -> ``kernel`` and similar
value population behavior.

Also removes an invalid test which was written before the
overall method was fully understood.

And fixes the default fallback for kickstart template
configuration, so that it uses a URL instead of a
direct file path.

And fix logic in the handling of image property result
set, where the code previously assumed a ``stage2``
ramdisk was always required, and based other cleanup
upon that.

Change-Id: I589e9586d1279604a743746952aeabbc483825df
(cherry picked from commit 4d653ac225a26dd83e81477f9d1152fe385c64aa)

commit_message:
Introduce skip list to inspector

Follow the same process of root device selection as in IPA
which changed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-python-agent/+/850861
The change introduces 'skip_block_devices' field into properties which
contains a list of hints pointing to devices that cannot be root devices

Change-Id: I94c8607ef9c610eadf1b5bce4fb154e97939a643
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/04/853304/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_skip_list_from_node(self, node, block_devices): skip_list_hints = node.node().properties.get("skip_block_devices", []) if not skip_list_hints: return skip_list = set() # serialized_devs = [dev.serialize() for dev in block_devices] for hint in skip_list_hints: found_devs = il_utils.find_devices_by_hints(block_devices, hint) excluded_devs = {dev['name'] for dev in found_devs} skipped_devices = excluded_devs.difference(skip_list) skip_list = skip_list.union(excluded_devs) if skipped_devices: LOG.warning("Using hint %(hint)s skipping devices: %(devs)s", {'hint': hint, 'devs': ','.join(skipped_devices)}) return skip_list skip_list = self._get_skip_list_from_node(node_info, inventory['disks']) if skip_list: inventory['disks'] = [d for d in inventory['disks'] if d['name'] not in skip_list]

commit_message:
Do not reboot into nowhere after BIOS settings with fast-track

Currently, the prepare_ramdisk implementation of the
redfish-virtual-media boot interface skips configuring an ISO in
fast-track mode. When rebooting after BIOS/RAID settings changes, we
need to enforce the correct ISO configuration.

Conflicts:
	ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/bios.py

Change-Id: Ibdfe0775065f3b27478305dd18929a291df3ee3c
(cherry picked from commit 89f421b166915a22626dcb919382ce13f4588973)
(cherry picked from commit d85d7f8ac52f289b7b01096c65757b68791f4bd4)

commit_message:
Add support for tcib_extra_config for master branch only

OSBS tool used in downstream to build wallaby container
doesnot support taking ARGS from FROM label in Dockerfile[1].
It is blocking the container build job[2].
So enabling tcib_extra_config for master only unblocks the line.

Links:
[1]. https://github.com/containerbuildsystem/dockerfile-parse/issues/118
[2]. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2128230

Change-Id: I4b68432080e6c87d60e281acd8dae994e85e2e01

commit_message:
[train-only] Use tripleo-admin as default

This script is used at many places to generate inventory.
Let's use tripleo-admin as the ssh_user in inventory.

Note: train-only as the script has been dropped in wallaby.

Change-Id: Ifa0451f42fccf519eec7574c08c302253d2acfb3

commit_message:
Disabling coverchange job for tripleo-validations

The coverchange job is no longer maintained and was phased out
in both validations-libs and validations-common repos.

Furthermore it provides little to no value, as it is non-voting
and defective.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I108baf9c1dec31637f9a037be10969eda30af347
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/75/839875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Revert "Fix cinder host name"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-08 20:59:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/75e8fbd9220141d79c797685964aa944b92c529f', 'message': 'Revert "Fix cinder host name"

This reverts commit d554d74bf0c6d61d63f92e1d8224881dd4fa726d.

This change is very problematic, because then the volumes will no longer be able to have API operations work on them, since the volumes are tied to a host, so when that host it down, things are bad.

We should keep this old (non-clean behaviour) and switch towards using Cinder clusters instead https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/high_availability.html

This means configuring a few other things, but this is a really bad change and will break production deployments.  I suggest we revert ASAP.

Change-Id: Iee54ef5feca5c8bee80aded75d2fd182a431adb3

commit_message:
Revert "Fix cinder host name"

This reverts commit d554d74bf0c6d61d63f92e1d8224881dd4fa726d.

This change is very problematic, because then the volumes will no longer be able to have API operations work on them, since the volumes are tied to a host, so when that host it down, things are bad.

We should keep this old (non-clean behaviour) and switch towards using Cinder clusters instead https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/high_availability.html

This means configuring a few other things, but this is a really bad change and will break production deployments.  I suggest we revert ASAP.

Change-Id: Iee54ef5feca5c8bee80aded75d2fd182a431adb3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-11-23 21:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/ports/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/tests.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d059b0bc40f04befc60657cd6504cc5711934b90', 'message': "Don't try and update port security if its not changing

Default policy in neutron doesn't allow port security to change
if network not owned by the user. To allow users to update other

commit_message:
Don't try and update port security if its not changing

Default policy in neutron doesn't allow port security to change
if network not owned by the user. To allow users to update other
attributes of a port don't send port_security_enabled attribute
to neutron unless it changes.

If user tries to change port security on a port in a network not
owned by them it will still error as it does now.

Partial-Bug: #1841050

Change-Id: I301336103cabc3f1cab3ee72d7743385ff1a10d6

commit_message:
The tox.ini file edited to explicitly define the python runtime environment

An error occurs while executing local tests if the user has more than one Python3 runtime installed. Currently supported version of python environment for tox tests is 3.8. Basepython was explicitly defined to version 3.8 so the error won't occur due to a different version.

Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7219d7d6e974eafbb615da201436c584ca316751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/56/857856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Automatic envs (pyXX) will only use the python version appropriate to that # env and ignore basepython inherited from [testenv] if we set # ignore_basepython_conflict.basepython = python3.8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-25 08:42:52.000000000', 'files': ['validations_libs/tests/test_utils.py', 'validations_libs/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs/commit/8a69f95e0acf4b3acdff00b2094d476fa463bc81', 'message': "Removing Popen object return from utils.run_command_and_log

as it was not beneficial to the purpose, or use of the function.

Before this patch, only call of the function setting 'retcode_only'
to 'True' was made in tests of the validations-libs. All other calls

and didn't supply the argument explicitly. Instead relying on
the default value.

In addition, it is not clear how would the Popen[0] object be
used, if it was returned.

"}]
commit_message:
Removing Popen object return from utils.run_command_and_log

Argument 'retcode_only' of the function and associated logic was removed
as it was not beneficial to the purpose, or use of the function.

Before this patch, only call of the function setting 'retcode_only'
to 'True' was made in tests of the validations-libs. All other calls
worked with assumption that Bool, not object will be returned,
and didn't supply the argument explicitly. Instead relying on
the default value.

In addition, it is not clear how would the Popen[0] object be
used, if it was returned.

The function has limited impact across Openstack[1],
only calls to it are made within validations-libs, although there is
a homonymous function withing tripleoclient intended
for the same task.

Docstring and tests were adjusted accordingly.

[0]https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html#popen-objects
[1]https://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=run_command_and_log&i=nope&literal=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3f9c2ef364de645a99d28c45c96560b78862c848
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs refs/changes/62/850862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def run_command_and_log(log, cmd, cwd=None, env=None): while True: try: line = proc.stdout.readline() except StopIteration: break if line != b'': if isinstance(line, bytes): line = line.decode('utf-8') log.debug(line.rstrip()) else: break proc.stdout.close() return proc.wait()
deleted_lines: def run_command_and_log(log, cmd, cwd=None, env=None, retcode_only=True): :param retcode_only: Returns only retcode instead or proc object :type retcdode_only: ``Boolean`` if retcode_only: while True: try: line = proc.stdout.readline() except StopIteration: break if line != b'': if isinstance(line, bytes): line = line.decode('utf-8') log.debug(line.rstrip()) else: break proc.stdout.close() return proc.wait() return proc

commit_message:
Ensure /var/lib/kolla/config_files exists

This directory, which defaults to /var/lib/kolla/config_files, needs to
exist and have the correct setype set.

Change-Id: I9695bd5f40867fee404f3af8606737559a32284c
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Avoid failure when non DPDK instances present

Avoid the validation failure when there are non DPDK instances. The playbook fails when there are instances not containing numatune, vcpupin or hugepages settings on the domain xml content.

Closes-Bug: #1988211

Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Martí <jmarti@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I243f7781cd72827c0a1f9623a7e994e63d1561b0
(cherry picked from commit 477aaa9877a25f5564fdc8b0a04be35091f9550f)

commit_message:
The tox.ini file edited to explicitly define the python runtime environment

An error occurs while executing local tests if the user has more than one Python3 runtime installed. Currently supported version of python environment for tox tests is 3.8. Basepython was explicitly defined to version 3.8 so the error won't occur due to a different version.

Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I07e6a29f9cf1393a6cd8784163c4575fd40ac25e

commit_message:
Remove the python3-openclient and add a new task.

The openstack-16.2-deployment-tools-for-rhel-8x86_64-rpms provide
everything needed without python3-openstackclient package.
Add a new task to add extra packages.

Change-Id: I2bb554a0d42a2df5a804a00e4086c04cade17285
(cherry picked from commit 3a929ba224275b34b0bc174eed5ae37653e8de19)

commit_message:
Fix Update ovn_controller. from external-update playbook

Remove unsupported container_cli parameter and replace log_path with
log_base_path in order in fix Update ovn_controller task. container_cli
and log_path are not supported parameters for (tripleo_container_manage)
module.

Closes-Bug: #1989342
Change-Id: Iadb78c5613f57cbdf92bbf8b40b0b9f83040d2a4
(cherry picked from commit 67c4988a5ac8cc248b8bee8a633dcb5fe7cb930d)

commit_message:
[wip] Cleanup useless variables

In patch 678b14c21a, the default package_state was moved to
"present" instead of latest.

The variables package_state, and *_package_state were used
to allow the deployer to move from "latest" to "present"
either globally or for a single play.

The wiring happened inside group vars because it was easier
that way to have variables defined and know their current
override value.

Now that the convention is aligned around having "present"
as default state, it does not make sense to keep overrides
to set the value to  "present", where in fact the majority
of the variables could be set in the role as
{{ package_state | default('present') }}, and no variables
inside each play.

Change-Id: I100217ca4b96d7801b8136d0d17cbfc77b3766c3
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/852567
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/+/852569

commit_message:
Ceph backup: Close source file

When doing a full backup the Ceph backup driver doesn't explicitly close
the source IOWrapper, so it will be closed by the Garbage Collector on a
green thread.

This patch changes this behavior and explicitly calls the close method
on a native thread.

This is the right thing to do, but this patch also helps with a unit
tests situation.

There are cases when running unit tests that the tests will fail to
return to the shell and a single "kill -USER2 <child_pid>" command will
unstack it.  This patch together with os-brick change
Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335 fixes the situation.

The issue is caused by the Garbage Collector calling the IOWrapper close
method and this one calling rbd_image.close().

Change-Id: I59bbad2283a1a2ae0e0bc670722468a2fe407666

commit_message:
Do not execute anything if a host is unreachable

If a host is unreachable, the default behaviour for
ansible is to ignore that and execute all the tasks
in the hosts that are reachable. This is unwanted
behaviour for B&R, as we need the whole controller
cluster to be healthy and reachable before we take
a backup from it. This patch introduces a mechanism
to abort execution if there is one or more
unreachable hosts.

Change-Id: I3820875e72a8d805d71c7981468398bbcec0bf04

commit_message:
Add release notes page for version 32.0.0

Tempest 32.0.0 has been released [1].

commit_message:
tests: Add a WarningsFixture

We will use this in the future to prepare for SQLAlchemy 2.0. For now,
we're simply using it to filter out some of the more annoying warnings
and to highlight general SQLAlchemy issues we need to address.

Change-Id: I7c26c20e4b36c4f3b98873939677b966ec6186a5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Isolate vif for ovs backend by default

Without that patch all deployers that did use OVS had to remember to
apply override for their deployments.
Now OSA will enable isolation of vif by default when OVS is used.

Change-Id: I4195153658c867f259226e80cefac0fcac4caac5
Related-Bug: #1734320

commit_message:
Add variable for setting certbot `domains` option

Add `haproxy_ssl_letsencrypt_domains` variable, which
contains a list (defaults to `external_lb_vip_address`)
for `--domains` certbot option.

Change-Id: I2ebfff9eeb5279a3964b8578a6e66aa132d763f5

commit_message:
Add missing rockylinux and openeuler entries

Our various nodepool launcher configs have gotten out of sync with
recent additions. Try to match them up better by adding rockylinux
and openeuler to places where they were missing. In particular, this
addresses an inconsistency on nl04 which caused the service to crash
at last restart due to rockylinux missing from the main diskimages
list.

Change-Id: Ie157ab7f667dbdc313b7fdbfc1df71874e8bd0fc

commit_message:
Reordering variable definitions to prevent empty includelist edge case

The existing order of variable definitions allowed for scenario where the include list
wouldn't have any contents. This in turn would lead to include list file not being created,
potentially causing job failure as tempest would attempt to read from it.

Related-Bug: #1990045

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I949f522348af95b957df4682fe342cb245382dad

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I3fff56eaeb17da1d231bdbf9e7809e7d41bc6963

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ieb6339cd677c76f0158cc19c9a0bf32b2237594d

commit_message:
Add tempest api tests for shared zones

Change-Id: I53a1e4676c5bbb63bee0c4bb91eac03c95dd3a3c
Partial-Bug: #1714088
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/726334

Author: Igor Malinovskiy <u.glide@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Drozdov <sergey.drozdov.dev@gmail.com, sergey.drozdov93@thehutgroup.com>
Change-Id: I926040558a6b360fcd088927e35d7668ea116c9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/25/858525/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2020 Cloudification GmbH. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from designate_tempest_plugin.tests import base from designate_tempest_plugin import data_utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = config.CONF class BaseSharedZoneTest(base.BaseDnsV2Test): credentials = ['primary', 'alt'] excluded_keys = ['created_at', 'updated_at', 'version', 'links', 'type'] @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(BaseSharedZoneTest, cls).resource_setup() LOG.info('Create a zone') _, cls.zone = cls.zone_client.create_zone() @classmethod def resource_cleanup(cls): cls.zone_client.delete_zone( cls.zone['id'], ignore_errors=lib_exc.NotFound) super(BaseSharedZoneTest, cls).resource_cleanup() @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(BaseSharedZoneTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.zone_client = cls.os_primary.zones_client cls.recordset_client = cls.os_primary.recordset_client cls.client = cls.os_primary.shared_zones_client cls.target_client = cls.os_alt.shared_zones_client cls.target_zone_client = cls.os_alt.zones_client cls.target_recordset_client = cls.os_alt.recordset_client def _share_zone(self, cleanup=True): LOG.info('Create a shared zone') _, shared_zone = self.client.share_zone( self.zone['id'], self.target_zone_client.tenant_id ) if cleanup: self.addCleanup(self.client.unshare_zone, shared_zone['id']) return shared_zone def _create_recordset(self, client): LOG.info('Create a recordset in the shared zone') rs_data = data_utils.rand_recordset_data( record_type='A', zone_name=self.zone['name']) _, rs = client.create_recordset(self.zone['id'], rs_data) self.addCleanup(client.delete_recordset, self.zone['id'], rs['id']) return rs class SharedZonesTest(BaseSharedZoneTest): @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): # Do not create network resources for these test. cls.set_network_resources() super(SharedZonesTest, cls).setup_credentials() @decorators.idempotent_id('982a7780-a460-4c13-97df-b4855bf19c7b') def test_share_zone(self): recordset = self._create_recordset(self.recordset_client) self._share_zone() # Create recordset from guest tenant self._create_recordset(self.target_recordset_client) LOG.info('Ensure target tenant has access to shared zone') _, zone = self.target_zone_client.show_zone(self.zone['id']) self.assertTrue(zone.get('shared')) _, body = self.target_zone_client.list_zones() self.assertEqual(1, len(body['zones'])) shared_zone_from_list = body['zones'][0] self.assertTrue(shared_zone_from_list.get('shared')) self.assertEqual(self.zone['id'], shared_zone_from_list['id']) LOG.info('Ensure target tenant has access to zone recordsets') _, guest_body = self.target_recordset_client.list_recordset( self.zone['id'] ) _, owner_body = self.recordset_client.list_recordset( self.zone['id'] ) # Guest and owner tenants should see all recordsets self.assertEqual(owner_body, guest_body) LOG.info('Ensure that shared zone recordsets is not listed in ' 'recordsets owned by target tenant') _, body = self.target_recordset_client.list_zones_recordsets() self.assertEqual(1, len(body['recordsets'])) LOG.info('Ensure that recordsets from shared zone are shown to target ' 'tenant') _, body = self.target_recordset_client.show_recordset( self.zone['id'], recordset['id'] ) self.assertEqual(recordset['id'], body["id"]) @decorators.idempotent_id('0edecb9b-4890-433c-8195-0935271efc9a') def test_show_shared_zone(self): shared_zone = self._share_zone() LOG.info('Re-Fetch the shared zone') _, body = self.client.show_shared_zone(shared_zone['id']) LOG.info('Ensure the fetched response matches the shared zone') self.assertExpected(shared_zone, body, self.excluded_keys) @decorators.idempotent_id('a18a8577-9d02-492a-a869-4ff7d6f4f89b') def test_unshare_zone(self): shared_zone = self._share_zone(cleanup=False) LOG.info('Unshare zone') _, body = self.client.unshare_zone(shared_zone['id']) LOG.info('Ensure the zone was unshared') self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, lambda: self.client.show_shared_zone(shared_zone['id'])) @decorators.idempotent_id('707bfa4f-f15b-4486-ba5c-0e5991f0f3a5') def test_list_shared_zones(self): self._share_zone() LOG.info('List zone exports') _, body = self.client.list_shared_zones() self.assertGreater(len(body['shared_zones']), 0) class NegativeSharedZonesTest(BaseSharedZoneTest): @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): # Do not create network resources for these test. cls.set_network_resources() super(NegativeSharedZonesTest, cls).setup_credentials() @decorators.idempotent_id('4389a12b-8609-493c-9640-d3c67b625022') def test_target_tenant_permissions(self): self._share_zone() LOG.info('Ensure target tenant cannot delete zone') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.Forbidden, self.target_zone_client.delete_zone, self.zone['id'] ) LOG.info('Ensure target tenant cannot share shared zone') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.Forbidden, self.target_client.share_zone, self.zone['id'], self.client.tenant_id ) @decorators.idempotent_id('abc0f820-ae27-4e85-8f00-0b8e8abf3ae9') def test_owner_cannot_unshare_zone_with_3rdparty_recordsets(self): shared_zone = self._share_zone() self._create_recordset(self.target_recordset_client) LOG.info('Ensure owner cannot unshare zone') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.BadRequest, self.client.unshare_zone, shared_zone['id'] )

revisions:

Multiple people have been mistaking the ~add and ~del syntax to
include a keyword "TRACK" which results in creating an actual track
by that name. Add chevrons around required parameters in the syntax

and not literal keywords.

Change-Id: I69d5b79d8d894f94919724c0f94225dbf959b20e
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify required parameter names in readme

Multiple people have been mistaking the ~add and ~del syntax to
include a keyword "TRACK" which results in creating an actual track
by that name. Add chevrons around required parameters in the syntax
documentation in order to make it clear those are parameter names
and not literal keywords.

Change-Id: I69d5b79d8d894f94919724c0f94225dbf959b20e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ptgbot refs/changes/00/858100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Anyone can privately message the bot with the following commands (chevrons like <> denote required parameters): * ``in <#TRACKNAME>`` - tells the bot you are currently in the track* ``in <LOCATION>`` - tells the bot you are currently in a location* ``seen <NICK>`` - asks the bot where the user with the given IRC nick* ``subscribe <REGEXP>`` - subscribes for a direct message notification #TRACKNAME <COMMAND> [PARAMETERS]You have to be a channel operator (+o) to use admin commands (chevrons like <> denote required parameters).~add <TRACK> [TRACK..]~del <TRACK> [TRACK..]~clean <TRACK> [TRACK..]~motd add <LEVEL> <MESSAGE>~motd del <N>~motd reorder <X> <Y> [Z...]~fetchdb <URL>
deleted_lines: Anyone can privately message the bot with the following commands: * ``in #TRACKNAME`` - tells the bot you are currently in the track* ``in LOCATION`` - tells the bot you are currently in a location* ``seen NICK`` - asks the bot where the user with the given IRC nick* ``subscribe REGEXP`` - subscribes for a direct message notification #TRACKNAME COMMAND [PARAMETERS]You have to be a channel operator (+o) to use admin commands.~add TRACK [TRACK..]~del TRACK [TRACK..]~clean TRACK [TRACK..]~motd add LEVEL MESSAGE~motd del N~motd reorder X Y...~fetchdb URL

commit_message:
Include libvirt role when using lookup file plugin

When import_role is used, then lookup plugin tries to find
nova_*.yaml files in tripleo_container_standalone instead
of in tripleo_nova_libvirt role directory.

Change-Id: I3cb8f5aaaf55324e7be2b3e64babc885f45d0975
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] bnr - Allow to skip the backup of images

Functionality to exclude the folders /var/lib/containers and /var/lib/image-serve from the rear backup. The backup of these folders depends on the value of the new tripleo_backup_and_restore_exclude_container_images variable

Change-Id: I9c2f413a8e347fb268a751acb482f2c44f83d056

commit_message:
Remove migration from undercloud-passwords.conf

This removes the logic to look up the existing passwords from
the undercloud-passwords.conf file during upgrade.

The file was generated by instackenv which is no longer used since
Rocky, thus the migration should have been done when a deployment is
upgraded from Queens to Rocky(Upgrade) or Train(FFU), and the logic
is no longer required in recent releases.

Change-Id: Id0aa63e4909aac5309c3828d0334cbeca08f5b30

commit_message:
Redis: replace hiera CLI

The hiera CLI is deprecated[1] in favor of the new ``puppet lookup``
command and doesn't work with the latest hieradata v5. However
the ``puppet lookup`` command requires gathering fact data and should
not be used outside of configuration tasks.
 [1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

This replaces the hiera CLI used to detect the listen address of
the stunnel service for redis, by parsing the stunnel.conf.

Change-Id: Ib1ed9bb4ba1e2d40ed415ddaa43a8528a3d058a9

Release horizon 23.0.0(Zed)

This patch cut a new release of the horizon which can
be used to create stable/zed branch as there are many
important changes feature/bug fixes are merged in horizon
since the last release.

commit_message:
List the NTP servers which chrony daemon is trying to access

Time synchronization is essential for successful deployment. The chrony daemon is used for connection with the NTP pool for receiving time data, if the connection is unsuccessful the deployment fails. This validation is recommended to run if the deployment is failing on time synchronization task. This validation prints NTP servers chrony is trying to access.

Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a18bd33d9aea11d0ad5ea1cc24205e543fa3dbc

This validation is recommended to run if the deployment is failing on time synchronization task. This validation prints NTP servers chrony is trying to access. groups: - pre-deployment categories: - undercloud products: - tripleo roles: - check_ntp_reachability

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

commit_message:
Release oswin-tempest-plugin for Zed

This patch proposes a release for oswin-tempest-plugin
to get the latest merged changes out prior to the final Zed going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 23.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ia508f5ed9b267de4e16a3a0eb6511e931fa87b06

commit_message:
Use context manager to open/close file

... to ensure all files are closed immediately when these files are
used. This also replaces one redundant usage to check existance of
a path by os.path.exists.

Change-Id: I9fe11e5c4ce14244cc4ce5e486db23e8c8cb740b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/91/857591/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with open(path, 'r') as f: return f.read() with open(path, 'wb') as f: f.write(json.dumps(config, indent=2).encode('utf-8'))
deleted_lines: f = open(path, 'r') return f.read() f = open(path, 'wb') f.write(json.dumps(config, indent=2).encode('utf-8'))

commit_message:
Rephrase independent model change task

Client libraries (and other libraries strongly tied to another
deliverable) should generally follow their parent deliverable release
model, even if they did not have a lot of activity themselves.

Rephrase 'evaluate' task to only consider non-client libraries for
model change.

Change-Id: Ifbe2889ada78cf52c56e6d261f47883300033f4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/32/857732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove redundant tempest-plugin release task

R-3 week's task for unreleased cycle-with-intermediary deliverables
contains also '--type tempest-plugin' however there is a dedicated task
for them in R-2. This patch keeps the dedicated task and removes the
redundant one from R-3.

This patch also adds a note with some task details to the modified task
to make it more clear.

Change-Id: I41906a133ff8925a5ed08b4bc52229e279651acb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/23/857723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --type horizon-plugin --type other --type service .. note:: The command lists some deliverables that clearly don't need a release (like requirements, release-tests). If there are multiple deliverables that require a release, then feel free to use ``process_auto_releases`` to generate the patches. Please use ``$series-cwi-not-released`` as topic.

Creating stable zed for vitrage

If you want to wait and make another release before the branch is cut,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that
patch to include another release and stable branch point.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday September 23.

commit_message:
Remove centos8s tag suffix

Kolla publishes images without that suffix since we only have c8s
CentOS variant - let's fix this (also fixes Kayobe).

Change-Id: I914d0b9817ad65f909d50a197488ac1038563e67

commit_message:
[train-only] Respect overcloud_ssh_key, if provided

This workflow was completely broken in train and was fixed
partially with I4dcaa29ab5eda3fa3272dd5ad1c1f9029ae98b2d. But,
it was still ignoring user provided overcloud_ssh_key, which is
fixed in this patch.

Change-Id: I60bbca98974b6c84007879f38422362e2b5633b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/28/854128/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not overcloud_ssh_key: overcloud_ssh_key = utils.get_key( stack=stack.stack_name, needs_pair=True) try: with open('{}.pub'.format(overcloud_ssh_key), 'rt') as fp: with open('{}'.format(overcloud_ssh_key), 'rt') as fp: mc.environments.get('ssh_keys').variables mc.environments.update(name='ssh_keys', variables={'public_key': pub_ssh_key, 'private_key': priv_ssh_key}) except OSError: pass except mistralclient_exc.APIException: mc.environments.create(name='ssh_keys', variables={'public_key': pub_ssh_key, 'private_key': priv_ssh_key})
deleted_lines: key = utils.get_key(stack=stack.stack_name, needs_pair=True) if key: with open('{}.pub'.format(key), 'rt') as fp: with open('{}'.format(key), 'rt') as fp: try: mc.environments.get('ssh_keys').variables mc.environments.update(name='ssh_keys', variables={'public_key': pub_ssh_key, 'private_key': priv_ssh_key}) except mistralclient_exc.APIException: mc.environments.create(name='ssh_keys', variables={'public_key': pub_ssh_key, 'private_key': priv_ssh_key})

commit_message:
Drop queue from deprecated-jobs.yaml

Currently on this review[1]. Zuul is complaining following
syntax error:
```
  extra keys not allowed @ data['gate']['queue']
  in "openstack/tripleo-ci/zuul.d/deprecated-jobs.yaml@master", line 394, column 3
```

Reason [2], zuul now supports queue declarations at project level.

It removes the queue zuul job param from here, as
deprecated-jobs.yaml no longer used anywhere.

It also removes unused tripleo-multinode-baremetal-full/minimal
pipeline.

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836/31#message-c320805f8ad84e33b0fa0ef5db70c721d5bdced0
[2]. https://lists.opendev.org/pipermail/service-announce/2022-September/000044.html
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3a0e2d83543c4d648c08556861fa8423948314f

subject: Remove argument to ssh-keygen for key size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 05:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/post_deploy/undercloud_post.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/11a79ab8f75f7661285590d64981f10525535da2', 'message': "Remove argument to ssh-keygen for key size

Latest crypto-policies enforce a minimum key size of 2048 via:

$ grep RSAMinSize /etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/openssh.config
RSAMinSize 2048

Since 1024 keys are already considered insecure let's have
ssh-keygen pick a more secure default.

Change-Id: Ic30c9e1f29ef5b9bf03569300afa4245bc0eb556
(cherry picked from commit aa424abf03d903f54e364b9e4695df7c34b51b96)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove argument to ssh-keygen for key size

Latest crypto-policies enforce a minimum key size of 2048 via:

$ grep RSAMinSize /etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/openssh.config
RSAMinSize 2048

Since 1024 keys are already considered insecure let's have
ssh-keygen pick a more secure default.

Change-Id: Ic30c9e1f29ef5b9bf03569300afa4245bc0eb556
(cherry picked from commit aa424abf03d903f54e364b9e4695df7c34b51b96)

stable/zed.

commit_message:
Ignore connection errors when getting ironic ports

as a followup to I24b08612c4ffc6aca60ca08f3ff5cc769c7c041d,
this solves the case when connectivity between inspector and ironic is
broken, which can lead to the same FSM being stuck in uninitialized mode
it can't get out of w/o restart.

Change-Id: Ie238a2fca7cc5ef4961c0cb0e639ffbbe69556f7
Story: #2008971
Task: #42611

commit_message:
Use hostNetwork for ephemeral heat pod

All other containers running in undercloud use host network.
This would avoid all future issues wrt netavark and ipv6 would
work seamlessly without any configuration of the podman bridge.

Change-Id: I1d01e149e11cdea1589c90df80445af3db359f6e

commit_message:
Nfs volume driver: Use different shares config file per backend

... to avoid conflicts when multiple backends are used. Previously
users always need to set the CinderNfsSharesConfig parameter to
avoid multiple backends from using the same share file. However this
requirement is redundant and causes the duplicate resource declaration
in puppet, which is usually unclear to users.

Change-Id: Ib9b664b39c92e2d29f1270641d9dba206c0e06f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/15/847715/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to undef $cinder_nfs_shares_config = undef, # NOTE(tkajinam): The nfs_shares_config parameter defaults to # /etc/cinder/shares.conf in puppet-cinder and is used to # create the shares config file. This causes duplicate # resource declaration when multiple NFS backends are # enabled. Define unique file names using backend names # to avoid the problem. $nfs_shares_config = pick($backend_config['CinderNfsSharesConfig'], pick($cinder_nfs_shares_config, "/etc/cinder/shares-${backend}.conf") 'nfs_shares_config' => $nfs_shares_config,

The newer placement-api package on Debian and Ubuntu uses the
updated file location.

commit_message:
CI: Changes to support Anaconda CI jobs

Introduces additional job configuration to enable automated
integration testing via tempest of the anaconda deployment
interface.

Also, configures a private subnet with DNS, which is required
by anaconda executing, in order to facilitate processing of URLs.

Change-Id: I61b5205cf2c9f83dfcabf4314247c76fb6a56acd

commit_message:
Correct Image properties lookup for paths

The image lookup process, when handed a path attempts
to issue a HEAD request against the path and gets a
response which is devoid of details like a content length
or any properties. This is expected behavior, however if
we have a path, we also know we don't need to explicitly
attempt to make an HTTP HEAD request in an attempt to
match the glance ``kernel_id`` -> ``kernel`` and similar
value population behavior.

Also removes an invalid test which was written before the
overall method was fully understood.

And fixes the default fallback for kickstart template
configuration, so that it uses a URL instead of a
direct file path.

And fix logic in the handling of image property result
set, where the code previously assumed a ``stage2``
ramdisk was always required, and based other cleanup
upon that.

Change-Id: I589e9586d1279604a743746952aeabbc483825df

commit_message:
Set /run/podman ACL before starting collectd

When collectd sensubility is enabled, the collectd requires access to
/run/podman. This change adds a separate container to update ACL of
the path before starting the collectd container.

Backport note:
This change removes usage of role specific container images which is

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I48cbe613e5a1704ef867541cfcaff3c4d940cc2b

commit_message:
Allow volumes in error_restoring/error_managing to be deleted

The list of statuses is based on the cinder API code [1].
In the API reference [2], 'in-use' is also mentioned,
but 'in-use' is not included as 'in-use' volumes can be
deleted only when 'force' flag is specified.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/ae5fd170f0a51306cc9ba44ba9d5fe4169fed239/cinder/volume/api.py#L480-L481
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=delete-a-volume-detail#delete-a-volume

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4a4f3fed1c8e02245573512a1e43749b03890324

commit_message:
Handle feature compatibility of HAProxy server-state-file option

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/805955 introduced
a new feature that requires HAProxy 1.6 or higher to work. This change
ensures that with older HAProxy version this feature does not get
enabled to avoid errors.

Story: 2010254
Task: 46145
Change-Id: Icc7dc9bb22187f908852c20415227574ded347aa

commit_message:
Add custom seccomp profile for ephemeral heat

This profile is similar to 'unconfined' would allow all
syscalls that cause issues with older podman versions.

Change-Id: Ibc8746762e9d5de2a2ed0afe92b53591c66d00a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/83/858283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create custom seccomp to allow syscalls when: - step|int == 1 - not ansible_check_mode|bool block: - name: Create directory for seccomp profile become: true file: mode: '0755' owner: root path: /var/lib/kubelet/seccomp state: directory - name: Create seccomp_allow.json become: true copy: dest: /var/lib/kubelet/seccomp/seccomp_allow.json content: | {"defaultAction": "SCMP_ACT_ALLOW", "syscalls": []}

commit_message:
Sync default policy rules

This patch updates default policy-in-code rules in horizon based on
nova/neutron/glance RC deliverables. It doesn't update policy
rules for cinder and keystone as I have found no changes in their
policy rules.

subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 12:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_random_fully-527b20bc524c308a.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/553777c52d0fbfa18a1830d41ac018d2e1dc8282', 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
(cherry picked from commit fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
(cherry picked from commit fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/854994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add ``use_random_fully`` setting to allow an operator to disable the iptables random-fully property on an iptable rules. issues: - | If the ``use_random_fully`` setting is disabled, it will prevent random fully from being used and if there're 2 guests in different networks using the same source_ip and source_port and they try to reach the same dest_ip and dest_port, packets might be dropped in the kernel do to the racy tuple generation . Disabling this setting should only be done if source_port is really important such as in network firewall ACLs and that the source_ip are never repeating within the platform.

commit_message:
Add snapshot deletion test

This adds a new test to ensure that snapshots
can be deleted when a volume is cloned from them.

Depends-On: I8ffb0c1130b30a19f336a98a9efef05905786af2
Change-Id: I18827bba3bc2730cde37696292b00a286bc53ef3

added_lines: from tempest.common import waiters @decorators.idempotent_id('e7028f52-f6d4-479c-8809-6f6cf96cfe0f') @utils.services('compute', 'volume') def test_snapshot_removal(self): volume_1 = self.create_volume_from_image() snapshot_1 = self.create_volume_snapshot(volume_1['id'], force=True) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( self.snapshots_client, snapshot_1['id'], 'available') clone_kwargs = {'snapshot_id': snapshot_1['id'], 'size': volume_1['size']} volume_2 = self.volumes_client.create_volume(**clone_kwargs)['volume'] waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( self.volumes_client, volume_2['id'], 'available') volume_2 = self.volumes_client.show_volume(volume_2['id'])['volume'] self.snapshots_client.delete(snapshot_1['id']) self.snapshots_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(snapshot_1['id']) self.volumes_client.delete(volume_1['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(volume_1['id']) self.volumes_client.delete(volume_2['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(volume_2['id'])

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4a4e652d6d7fabe5ce7b6fc5b0b6391957a7cbc5

subject: Add an active wait during the port provisioning event
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 07:45:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-port-provisioning-retry-8edf16a258b164a0.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d2d650a20a24004f51182b0458d6139a9d4bede', 'message': 'Add an active wait during the port provisioning event

In ML2/OVN, during a live-migration process, it could
happend that the port provisioning event is received before
the port binding has been updated. That means the port has
been created in the destination host and the event received
(this event will remove any pending provisioning block). But
the Nova port binding request has not arrived yet, updating
the port binding registers. Because the port is considered
"not bound" (yet), the port provisioning doesn't set the port
status to ACTIVE.

This patch creates an active wait during the port provisioning
event method. If the port binding is still "unbound", the method
retries the port retrieval several times, giving some time to the
port binding request from Nova to arrive.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1988199
Change-Id: I50091c84e67c172c94ce9140f23235421599185c
(cherry picked from commit 91f0864dc0ccf0f67be7162f011706dbc6383cb3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add an active wait during the port provisioning event

In ML2/OVN, during a live-migration process, it could
happend that the port provisioning event is received before
the port binding has been updated. That means the port has
been created in the destination host and the event received
(this event will remove any pending provisioning block). But
the Nova port binding request has not arrived yet, updating
the port binding registers. Because the port is considered
"not bound" (yet), the port provisioning doesn't set the port
status to ACTIVE.

This patch creates an active wait during the port provisioning
event method. If the port binding is still "unbound", the method
retries the port retrieval several times, giving some time to the
port binding request from Nova to arrive.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1988199
Change-Id: I50091c84e67c172c94ce9140f23235421599185c
(cherry picked from commit 91f0864dc0ccf0f67be7162f011706dbc6383cb3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/857567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | After the port is considered as provisioned, the Nova port binding update could have not been received, leaving the port as not bound. Now the port provisioning method has an active wait that will retry several times, waiting for the port binding update. If received, the port status will be set as active if the admin state flag is set.

commit_message:
Retry ansible-galaxy commands

It may happen ansible-galaxy fails to install due to remote issue
(usually hitting a 502 error on their side).

Adding a retry should help avoiding hard failures. Note that the time
between retries will be increasing, in order to make the overall thing
less stressful for the remote server.

Change-Id: I28cc5b66ca9b9b16b07c57c0c4fe87a77265ba86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/62/858262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: retry() { local -r -i max_attempts="$1"; shift local -i attempt_num=1 until "$@"; do if ((attempt_num==max_attempts)); then echo "Max attempt ${max_attempts} reached, '$@' still failing, abandonning." exit 1 fi echo "Attemp ${attempt_num} failed. Retrying..." sleep $((attempt_num++)) done } retry 10 ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ retry 10 ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv \ retry 10 ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ retry 10 ansible-galaxy role install -vvv --force \ retry 10 ansible-galaxy role install -vvv \
deleted_lines: ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv \ ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ ansible-galaxy role install -vvv --force \ ansible-galaxy role install -vvv \

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv for py37

py37 test started to fail with latest virtualenv (20.16.4) as it
bundles setuptools 65.3.0, which causes installation problems under
py37. (Note: with py38 the problem does not occur).

This patch sets virtualenv<20.16.4 to unblock the gate as
virtualenv 20.16.3 bundles setuptools 63.4.1, with which py37 gate
works well.

NOTE(stephenfin): Modified to remove the failing l-c job.

Change-Id: I8c457d06b79cacc770db62eac1d8e4459052d5ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/31/855931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Pin setuptools via virtualenv as latest virtualenv pulls in 65.3.0 # version of setuptools for py37, which causes installation problems # (virtualenv 20.16.3 uses setuptools 63.4.1). requires = virtualenv<20.16.4

subject: Fix redirect after deleting from details page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-13 17:33:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f46b7f3ec4ed31ac171877319fda3fc0e0da12b9', 'message': 'Fix reirect after deleting from details page

On apache environments, when WEBROOT is "/dashboard/" and not "/",
redirection after deleting from Angular details page is broken. If
we go to image/key pair/server group/etc details page, and delete
it from this page, redirect url is "/dashboard/dashboard/project/..."
instead of "/dashboard/project/..."

This patch switches from using WEBROOT depentent panel navigation to
getting default index url directly from details view controller.
It also cleans up a work around that was implemented for some pages.

Change-Id: I6bd06ea479f473a319f8100cbf8d168424b62461

commit_message:
Fix redirect after deleting from details page

On apache environments, when WEBROOT is "/dashboard/" and not "/",
redirection after deleting from Angular details page is broken. If
we go to image/key pair/server group/etc details page, and delete
it from this page, redirect url is "/dashboard/dashboard/project/..."
instead of "/dashboard/project/..."

This patch switches from using WEBROOT depentent panel navigation to
getting default index url directly from details view controller.
It also cleans up a work around that was implemented for some pages.

Change-Id: I6bd06ea479f473a319f8100cbf8d168424b62461

commit_message:
Drop Nodejs14 job

As horizon already used nodejs16 job[1]. So we didn't require
the nodejs14 job. This patch removes the nodejs14 job definition
from ``.zuul.d/nodejs-jobs.yaml``. Also, a series of patches for
horizon plugins to use the nodejs16 job is already up [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/831929
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:migrate-to-nodejs16

Change-Id: I170520ad99176e8ef31d8f52a3b012339fd80837

commit_message:
Fix list of DNS extensions supported by OVN

The OVN driver needs to announce all DNS extensions as supported,
otherwise the neutron server will reject them.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/ovn/features.rst
	neutron/common/ovn/extensions.py

Closes-Bug: 1947127
Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Ic269902ef7a16893c4ea624b04347d04db4f52d9

commit_message:
Retry connections to Nova

Sometimes Neutron is failing to send notification to Nova
due to timeout, refused connection or another HTTP error.
Retry send in those cases.

Closes-Bug: #1987780
Change-Id: Iaaccec770484234b704f70f3c144efac4d8ffba0
(cherry picked from commit cd475f9af898b81d98b3e0d3f55b94ea653c193c)

commit_message:
Fix indentation issue in wait_for_change override

The ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.idlutils.wait_for_change method was
overriden in Ia9e23113fdeebf0b99085da200c3d61b71567d36. Unfortunately,
and indentation error was introduced which rendered the method as a
NoOp if a seqno was passed to it.

Closes-Bug: #1989646
Change-Id: I9d8db215ba19ea88bc615b7b30084113a3c953d4
(cherry picked from commit fb7d937adae140520dae94a47d696ce202479ab5)
(cherry picked from commit 15150ed9c7e8de21af504c087b4472542080058e)
(cherry picked from commit 3f146db5a70fe9625269b750c2e824d271421f0c)

added_lines: while idl_.change_seqno == seqno and not idl_.run(): poller = idlutils.poller.Poller() idl_.wait(poller) poller.block()
deleted_lines: while idl_.change_seqno == seqno and not idl_.run(): poller = idlutils.poller.Poller() idl_.wait(poller) poller.block()

commit_message:
Add new boot_server_attach_created_volume_and_extend test

This adds a new job to the nova scenarios that creates a server
and volume, attaches the volume and then extends the volume
while it's attached to the server as introduced in Pike [1].

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/implemented/nova-support-attached-volume-extend.html

Change-Id: Ia30f6fb65d3d60f02816125f47b545465f36f148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/41/854341/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% set flavor_name = flavor_name or "m1.tiny" %} --- NovaServers.boot_server_attach_created_volume_and_extend: - args: flavor: name: "{{flavor_name}}" image: name: "^cirros.*-disk$" volume_size: 1 new_volume_size: 2 force_delete: false do_delete: true boot_server_kwargs: {} create_volume_kwargs: {} runner: type: "constant" times: 10 concurrency: 2 context: users: tenants: 3 users_per_tenant: 2 sla: failure_rate: max: 0

commit_message:
Fix indentation issue in wait_for_change override

The ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.idlutils.wait_for_change method was
overriden in Ia9e23113fdeebf0b99085da200c3d61b71567d36. Unfortunately,
and indentation error was introduced which rendered the method as a
NoOp if a seqno was passed to it.

Closes-Bug: #1989646
Change-Id: I9d8db215ba19ea88bc615b7b30084113a3c953d4
(cherry picked from commit fb7d937adae140520dae94a47d696ce202479ab5)
(cherry picked from commit 15150ed9c7e8de21af504c087b4472542080058e)

" #, python-format msgid "" "'%(prot)s' is invalid for flashsystem_connection_protocol in config file. " msgid "'consistencygroup_id' must be specified" msgstr "'consistencygroup_id'를 지정해야 함" msgid "'qemu-img info' parsing failed." msgstr "'qemu-img info' 구문 분석에 실패했습니다. " msgid "A concurrent, possibly contradictory, request has been made." msgstr "동시에 모순된 요청이 수행되었습니다." msgid "A valid secondary target MUST be specified in order to failover." msgstr "장애 복구하려면 올바른 보조 대상을 지정해야 합니다." #, python-format msgid "" "API Version String %(version)s is of invalid format. "MinorNum 이어야 합니다." #, python-format msgid "API response: %s" msgstr "API 응답: %s" #, python-format msgid "API version %(version)s is not supported on this method." msgstr "API 버전 %(version)s에서는 이 메소드를 지원하지 않습니다.." msgid "Access list not available for public volume types." msgstr "액세스 목록을 공용 볼륨 유형에 사용할 수 없습니다. " msgid "Activate or deactivate QoS error." msgstr "QoS 활성화 또는 비활성화 오류입니다. " msgid "Activate snapshot error." msgstr "스냅샷 활성화 오류입니다. " msgid "Add FC port to host error." msgstr "호스트에 FC 포트 추가 오류입니다. Non-existent pools: %s" msgstr "" "관리될 모든 지정된 스토리지 풀이 존재하지 않습니다. 구성을 확인하십시오. 존재" "하지 않는 풀: %s" msgid "An API version request must be compared to a VersionedMethod object." msgstr "API 버전 요청은 VersionedMethod 오브젝트와 비교해야 합니다." msgid "An error has occurred during backup operation" msgstr "백업 조작 중에 오류가 발생함 " #, python-format msgid "" "An error occurred during the LUNcopy operation. LUNcopy 상태: %(luncopystate)s." #, python-format msgid "An invalid 'name' value was provided. %(reason)s" msgstr "유효하지 않은 'name' 값이 제공되었습니다. %(reason)s" #, python-format msgid "An invalid 'target_protocol' value was provided: %(protocol)s" msgstr "유효하지 않은 'target_protocol' 값이 제공되었습니다 : %(protocol)s" msgid "An unknown exception occurred." msgstr "알 수 없는 예외가 발생했습니다." msgid "Append port group description error." msgstr "포트 그룹 설명 추가 오류." #, python-format msgid "" "Applying the zones and cfgs to the switch failed (error code=%(err_code)s " "error msg=%(err_msg)s." msgstr "" "구역과 cfgs를 스위치에 적용하는 데 실패했습니다(오류 코드=%(err_code)s 오류 " "메시지=%(err_msg)s." #, python-format msgid "Array does not exist or is offline. Current status of array is %s." msgstr "" "배열이 존재하지 않거나 오프라인 상태입니다. 배열의 현재 상태는 %s입니다. " msgid "Associate host to hostgroup error." msgstr "호스트 그룹에 호스트 연관 오류입니다. " msgid "Associate host to mapping view error." msgstr "맵핑 보기에 호스트 연관 오류입니다. " msgid "Associate initiator to host error." msgstr "호스트에 개시자 연관 오류입니다. " #, python-format msgid "Backup driver reported an error: %(reason)s" msgstr "백업 드라이버 오류 보고서: %(reason)s" msgid "Backup operation of an encrypted volume failed." msgstr "암호화된 볼륨의 백업 조작이 실패했습니다." #, python-format msgid "Backup should only have one snapshot but instead has %s" msgstr "백업에 하나의 스냅샷만 있어야 하지만 대신 %s개가 있음" msgid "Backup status must be available" msgstr "백업 상태가 사용 가능해야 함" #, python-format msgid "Backup status must be available and not %s." msgstr "백업 상태는 사용 가능해야 하며 %s이(가) 아니어야 합니다." msgid "Backup status must be available or error" msgstr "백업 상태는 사용 가능 또는 오류여야 함" msgid "Backup to be restored has invalid size" msgstr "복원할 백업이 올바르지 않은 크기임" #, python-format msgid "Bad HTTP response status %(status)s" msgstr "잘못된 HTTP 응답 상태 %(status)s" #, python-format msgid "Bad key(s) in quota set: %s" msgstr "할당량 세트의 잘못된 키: %s" #, python-format msgid "" "Bad or unexpected response from the storage volume backend API: %(data)s" msgstr "스토리지 볼륨 백엔드 API로부터 잘못되었거나 예상치 못한 응답: %(data)s" #, python-format msgid "Bad reset resource status : %(reason)s" msgstr "잘못된 리셋 자원 상태 : %(reason)s" msgid "Bad response from Datera API" msgstr "Datera API의 잘못된 응답" msgid "Bad response from SolidFire API" msgstr "SolidFire API의 잘못된 응답" #, python-format msgid "Bad response from XMS, %s" msgstr "XMS의 잘못된 응답, %s" msgid "Binary" msgstr "2진" msgid "Blank components" msgstr "비어 있는 구성요소" #, python-format msgid "Brocade Fibre Channel Zoning CLI error: %(reason)s" msgstr "Brocade Fibre Channel Zoning CLI 오류: %(reason)s" #, python-format msgid "Brocade Fibre Channel Zoning HTTP error: %(reason)s" msgstr "Brocade Fibre Channel Zoning HTTP 오류: %(reason)s" msgid "CHAP secret should be 12-16 bytes." msgstr "CHAP 본인확인정보는 12바이트 - 16바이트여야 합니다. " """ #, python-format msgid "CPG (%s) doesn't exist on array" msgstr "배열에 CPG(%s)가 없음" msgid "Can not add FC port to host." msgstr "호스트에 FC 포트를 추가할 수 없습니다." #, python-format msgid "Can not get pool info. pool: %s" msgstr "풀 정보를 가져올 수 없습니다. 풀: %s" #, python-format msgid "Can not translate %s to integer." msgstr "%s을(를) 정수로 변환할 수 없습니다. commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: If70806d289c5ee2079183bff0243b1e0769569d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-dashboard refs/changes/96/858396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Iaabdc37178a7a37dc5ac12561018fbe8f8f47ff1

commit_message:
Switch fs001 to Deploy Undercloud with OVN

[1] Added an environment file to allow Undercloud
Deployments with Ml2 OVN.

This patch switches fs001 master ovb job to deploy
Undercloud with Ml2 OVN so to have coverage of it
on Undercloud before it becomes default Ml2 Plugin on
Undercloud in future.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/857436

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/857436
Change-Id: Ie273fa4cfa26f3707788c91bb09f3dc1003e8beb

commit_message:
Fix healthMonitor events affecting to unrelated LB

When an ServiceMonitorUpdateEvent happens, only those affected
pools, listeners or LBs need to update their operating_status.

This patch fixes the propagation of the affected member_id to
other loadbalancers, as the search variable once set was not
restarted when starting the parsing of another LB.

Closes-Bug: #1986977
Change-Id: Ifbc836c6247add940c6392b2eda11e7e240fd36a
(cherry picked from commit 9fba870f6be56df6da9b303c378a983813ac31a7)

commit_message:
Remove linter testing as pip dependencies won't install anymore.

We also remove the duplicate zuul definition and keep
zuul.d/layout.yaml as it's the default on the tripleo project.

Change-Id: I17affa26617f62444f1b768a9bc41e2ff4dafac9
Closes-Bug: #1989005

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv for py37

py37 test started to fail with latest virtualenv (20.16.4) as it
bundles setuptools 65.3.0, which causes installation problems under
py37. (Note: with py38 the problem does not occur).

This patch sets virtualenv<20.16.4 to unblock the gate as
virtualenv 20.16.3 bundles setuptools 63.4.1, with which py37 gate
works well.

NOTE(stephenfin): Modified to remove the (failing) l-c job.

Change-Id: I3cff2315d7553a81101b57239925494af3e62b37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/59/855959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Pin setuptools via virtualenv as latest virtualenv pulls in 65.3.0 # version of setuptools for py37, which causes installation problems # (virtualenv 20.16.3 uses setuptools 63.4.1). requires = virtualenv<20.16.4
